reference.title: Help and Support Resources
reference.shortdesc: Key resources available to assist authors, designers, and administrators while working in Author-it.

section.title: Author-it Knowledge Center
section.p: The Author-it Knowledge Center is the primary source of information for all Author-it products, modules, release notes, and troubleshooting guidance.
Users can reach the Knowledge Center in two ways:

row.entry: Opens the online Knowledge Center directly from the Author-it interface.
Opens the Knowledge Center in a browser without starting the Author-it client.

section.p: The Knowledge Center includes extensive documentation, such as:

p.i: Figure 14: How to visit the Knowledge Center for help

ul.li: Help topics for every Author-it module (including those not installed in a new environment)

section.p: The search bar accepts keywords, filters, and module-specific narrowing to help find relevant articles.
Technical support teams frequently share direct links from the Knowledge Center, making it the best place to search before opening a support ticket.

section.title: Additional Support Options
section.p: If the Knowledge Center does not address an issue, users may contact Author-it Technical Support through the organization’s support plan or portal. Support representatives commonly refer to Knowledge Center articles, so reviewing them first may resolve the issue immediately.
